alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 31 at 8:55PM CDT until April 07 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .The combination of heavy rain and snow melt upstream will result in rises along the Yellow River at Necedah. There is a potential that this river could rise above the 15 foot minor flood stage by late Sunday evening. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Friday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 900 AM CDT.
